title: [Large-scale] Animation-Based Social Studies Simulation Teaching Method Design

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational educational theory and comprehension of social studies curriculum content
context.additional_context: Course for pre-service teachers to empirically explore animation utilization effects in social studies lessons while practicing instructional design in VR simulation environments

learning_goals: Learners can compare and explain the educational effectiveness differences between animations and static graphics

Learners can design a 10-minute lesson simulation structured in three stages (introduction-development-conclusion) using system-paced animation with audio explanations (e.g., Adobe Animate or Unity-based) within 2–4 weeks and achieve 3.5 or higher out of 5 on a peer evaluation rubric (content clarity, technical completeness, educational effectiveness).

Learners can develop one animation-based social studies lesson model through project-based assessment over 2–4 weeks, achieve an average of 4 or higher on peer and instructor evaluation rubrics (5-point scale, four items), and analyze implementation results with quantitative data (participation rate over 80%) and qualitative feedback (student surveys).
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
